front.title: A Framework for QoS-Enabled Semantic Routing in Industrial Networks

abstract.t: Industrial networks pose unique challenges in realizing a communication substrate on the shop floor. Such challenges are due to strict Quality of Service (QoS) requirements, a wide range of protocols for data exchange, and highly heterogeneous network infrastructures. In this regard, this document proposes a framework for QoS-enabled semantic routing in industrial networks. Such a framework aims at providing loosely-coupled, asynchronous communications, fine-grained traffic management (delivery semantics and flow priorities), and in-network traffic optimization.
